title: Boundary-Crossing Language Learning for Interdisciplinary Communication: An Integrated Text-Lexis-Expression Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic job-related language skills (reading, writing, speaking, listening) and general comprehension of other fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Project-based learning for professionals in healthcare/legal/technical fields, conducted primarily via smartphones: integrates discipline-specific terminology with everyday language and applies multicultural communication scenarios.

learning_goals: Collaborate with peers from diverse fields to complete one project that solves practical language issues (e.g., technical term translation, cultural context interpretation) through an interdisciplinary approach.

Conduct a practical exercise comparing and connecting vocabulary usage patterns and text structures across three or more interdisciplinary fields using language analysis tools (e.g., corpus analysis software).

Create a mutual learning journal based on conversation records with experts from other fields during real-time online discussions, including analysis of grammatical structures, discourse strategies, and non-verbal expressions.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
